title: As it happened: Champions League final fans in Cardiff - BBC News
summary: juventus take on real madrid in the champions league final at 19:45 .
more than 170,000 visitors are expected in cardiff on saturday .
road closures are in place across the city .
motorists are urged to avoid the m4 for the whole of match day as it will be busy .

documents.title: time to let the football do the talking
text: thanks for your company this afternoon , the atmosphere in cardiff has been electric .
all eyes now turn to the pitch .
juventus take on reigning champions real madrid at 19:45 and you can see live updates on the match here .

documents.title: know your stadium
text: know your stadium

documents.title: new name
text: the principality stadium has been renamed the national stadium of wales for tonight 's final .
the roof of the 70,000-capacity venue will be closed for the game for safety reasons .

documents.title: it 's not only the brits who love a queue
text: fans line up to get into the stadium .
the advice is to aim to be inside by 17:45 as additional security checks will be in place .

documents.title: three arrested
text: three men have been arrested in cardiff city centre on sus of ticket touting offences , south wales police said .
one man was arrested on friday and two on saturday .
they have all been remanded in custody .

documents.title: planes , trains and automobiles
text: more than 170,000 people are expected to descend on cardiff today for the champions league final - 70,000 of them have tickets to the game .
about 22,500 are arriving by air to cardiff , bristol and birmingham airports .
and 1,250 coaches will be bringing fans from more than 30 towns and cities across england .
the m4 and all the main roads into cardiff will be busiest until 20:00 on saturday and again from 22:00 until 03:00 on sunday .
cardiff central , cardiff queen street and cardiff bay railway stations are expected to be exceptionally busy until 04:00 on sunday .

documents.title: lost at home ?
text: ten players have suffered final heartbreak in their hometown - including londoners rio ferdinand and chris smalling , munich-born philipp lahm , and thierry henry who comes from les ulis , paris .

documents.title: who 's who ?
text: these five have all lifted the trophy in their hometown .
real madrid 's gareth bale will be hoping to do the same !

documents.title: hometown heroes
text: gareth bale will be hoping to join an exclusive club of champions league winners to lift the trophy in their hometown when current champions real madrid face juventus in cardiff .
only five other players in history have done so .

documents.title: family fortunes
text: denbigh brothers gareth and rhodri jones did n't know each other had tickets - now they are sitting seven rows apart !

documents.title: where can i drive ?
text: road closures in the welsh capital will remain until 03:30 on sunday .

documents.title: 'wonderful atmosphere '
text: joann randles was out early in cardiff this morning taking photos of fans .
`` it 's a really wonderful atmosphere here , '' she said .

documents.title: move over ronaldothere 's a new kid in town
text: move over ronaldothere 's a new kid in town

documents.title: it 's party time !
text: a four-day festival kicked off in cardiff bay on thursday and will be open on saturday until 17:00 .
the champions main stage in roald dahl plass will host artists , djs and bands .
and the uefa champions gallery , a museum celebrating the ucl 's history , will be inside the wales millennium centre .
but the game will not be screened at the site .

documents.title: festival time !
text: fans of both sides are soaking up the festival atmosphere in cardiff bay .

documents.title: guess who ?
text: it 's # uclfinal day and in case you 'd forgotten what teams were playing - here 's a clue about one with a very famous cardiff son

documents.title: brides taking sides
text: there 's no escaping football fever today , not even if you 're getting married .

documents.title: ticket alert
text: the football association of wales and uefa are warning supporters that fake tickets are in circulation for the champions league final .
they say `` robust security checks '' will detect all counterfeit tickets and therefore entry to the stadium will be denied to any person in possession of one .

documents.title: little italy
text: flags are flying for italy at the juventus fan meeting point in callaghan square where some supporters are catching some shut eye and others are already on the ball .

documents.title: keeping the city safe
text: one of the biggest security operations ever undertaken in cardiff is now under way .
there will be 2,000 deployments of police officers , including armed officers , throughout the city .
and police have applied for extra powers to stop and search people at the event if violence breaks out .
streets immediately surrounding the national stadium of wales are off limits for anyone without a match ticket and no bags are allowed in the stadium .

documents.title: stadium facts : will history repeat itself ?
text: stadium facts : will history repeat itself ?

documents.title: what 's happening when ?
text: here 's a handy guide to what 's going on around the city today .

documents.title: the atmosphere is building
text: cardiff is already buzzing with football fans .

documents.title: welcome
text: hello !
it 's champions league final day and we 'll be bringing you all the build-up to tonight 's match between real madrid and juventus in cardiff .
